intro: Stenanthemum poicilum, commonly known as the variable stenanthemum, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit. The plant features narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine, silky hairs. Its flowers are typically small and clustered, appearing in shades of pink or red. Stenanthemum poicilum is well adapted to dry, sandy soils and is often found in heathlands and coastal areas.
